title: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: PM Conferred With Ghana's National Honour
content: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: The Prime Minister will visit Argentina, Ghana, Namibia, Brazil, and Trinidad and Tobago. Ghana will be the first stop in the Prime Minister's visit, where he will meet President John Dramani Mahama

title: Retired US Cop's Body Found Under Piles Of Trash, Mice, Used Toilet Paper
content: The Glastonbury Police have released photos and videos of a house where the remains of a retired Bridgeport police detective were discovered under ceiling-high piles of garbage, eight months after she went missing.

title: Trump's "Big, Beautiful Bill" Awaits Final Vote: How It Will Impact Indians
content: US President Donald Trump's signature tax-and-spending legislation-- One Big, Beautiful Bill"-- is lined up for final vote over the coming hours in the House of Representatives, the lower chamber of the American Congress.

title: US House Sets Make-Or-Break Final Vote On Trump Tax Bill Soon
content: US lawmakers teed up a final vote on Donald Trump's marquee tax and spending bill for early Thursday after a bruising day of Republican infighting that threatened to derail the centerpiece of the president's domestic agenda.

title: Opinion: Opinion | RFK Jr Is Playing With Babies' Lives
content: Robert F Kennedy Jr's decision to withdraw US funding from the global vaccine alliance GAVI, may kill far more children than anything he has so far tried at home.

title: $1,000,000,000: This Is How Much Harvard Will Lose If Trump Okays Fund Cuts
content: Harvard University may lose up to $1 billion annually if US President Donald Trump goes ahead with his plans to cut research funding, tax policy and student enrollment, according to a new report in a leading American daily.

title: Man Accused Of Raping Techie After Breaking Into Her Pune House Arrested
content: A 25-year-old woman living in a posh residential society in Pune was raped at home by a man disguised as a courier delivery staff

title: Door Open For New TV Rating Agencies As Ministry Plans Overhaul Of Norms
content: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has proposed an overhaul of guidelines governing television rating agencies that will likely open the door to more players in the television ratings space.

title: Thai Opposition To Hold Off On No-Confidence Vote Against Government
content: Thailand's opposition parties said they will hold off on launching a no-confidence vote against suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra pending a court ruling, but they vowed to work together to avoid political deadlock.

title: Trump's Big Bill Cuts Clean Energy Tax, Residential Solar To Get Hit Fast
content: The bill in the Housetakes anaxto clean energy incentives, including killing a 30% tax credit for rooftop residential solar by the end of the year that the Biden administration'sInflation Reduction Acthad extended into the next decade.

title: Peru Fines Lima Clinic $190,000 For Leak Of Shakira's Medical Records
content: A Peruvian regulator hit private health-care provider Auna SA with a stiff fine for the unauthorised disclosure of medical records belonging to popular singer Shakira.

title: Stranded F-35B Fighter Jet In Kerala To Get C-17 Globemaster Farewell
content: Nineteen days after a British F-35B stealth fighter jet made an unscheduled landing at Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram International Airport, the state-of-the-art aircraft remains grounded.

title: Iran's Nuke Programme Set Back By Up To 2 Years, Courtesy US Airstrikes
content: US airstrikes on Iran set back the country's nuclear program by one to two years, a Pentagon spokesman said, adding to uncertainty around the status of the country's facilities after President Donald Trump said they'd been obliterated.

title: Opinion: Opinion | To Understand Musk-Trump Splitsville, You Must Look At Mamdani
content: To understand the peculiar three-way conflict involving Trump, Musk, and Mamdani, you have to understand what makes America prosperous and yet the Average Joe or Jane unhappy.

title: What Is The Mann Act, The Law Used To Convict Sean 'Diddy' Combs
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs was convicted Wednesday of prostitution-related offenses under the federal Mann Act, an anti-sex trafficking law with a century-old history. Combs was still convicted of flying people around to engage in paid sexual encounters.

title: 4 Detained, Questioned After Actors Arrested In Chennai Cocaine Case
content: The Chennai Police's high-profile investigation into an alleged cocaine network linked to actors, political operatives, and foreign nationals has intensified, with four key individuals taken under police custody - Prasad, Pradeep, Kevin, and John.

title: Where Does Sean 'Diddy' Combs' Business Empire Stand After Conviction
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs has been acquitted of the most serious charges in his federal sex trafficking trial, but that doesn't mean the once-celebrated music mogul will see his business empire restored. He was still convicted of prostitution charges.

title: 13% Children Born Prematurely. 17% With Low Birth Weight In India: Report
content: India's demographic health survey 2019-21 reveals that 13 per cent of children were born prematurely, and 17 per cent with a low weight at birth, with air pollution contributing to the adverse birth outcomes.

title: Disha Salian Died By Suicide, No Evidence Found: Mumbai Police Tell Court
content: Former celebrity manager Disha Salian died by suicide and no foul play has been found in her death, the Mumbai police have submitted to the Bombay High Court, even as her father Satish Salian reiterated she was gangraped and murdered.

title: 4 Minors Arrested In Delhi's Murder Cum Robbery Case
content: Four Juveniles have been apprehended after nearly a week in connection with the alleged murder of a man in Delhi's Bawana, police said in a release.

title: ‘Deeply humiliated’: Cop opts for VRS after Sidda’s 'air slap'; BJP demands CM's apology
content: NV Baramani, a Karnataka ASP, chose to retire. This followed public criticism. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's actions at a Belagavi rally led to this. Baramani cited humiliation as the reason. The incident involved a perceived slap gesture. It sparked controversy and media attention. BJP leaders demanded an apology from Siddaramaiah. The event caused Baramani mental distress.

title: Diogo Jota dead: Liverpool footballer dies in car accident in Spain
content: Tragedy struck early Thursday morning as Liverpool footballer Diogo Jota, 28, and his brother Andre Felipe, 26, tragically died in a car accident in Zamora, Spain. They had gone off road after their tyre burst and the car caught fire. The emergency services reached the spot but were unable to help.

title: US: Indian-origin pediatrician kills her daughter; stages death to look like drowning
content: Neha Gupta, an Oklahoma pediatrician, faces a first-degree murder charge in Florida for the death of her four-year-old daughter, Aria Talathi. Initially reported as a drowning, an autopsy revealed Aria died from asphyxiation by smothering, with injuries inconsistent with Gupta's account. Detectives uncovered a bitter custody battle between Gupta and her ex-husband, adding complexity to the case.

title: Moonlighting in Silicon Valley: Soham Parekh's resume goes viral; techie accused of job scam
content: Soham Parekh, a software engineer, faces accusations of secretly juggling multiple jobs simultaneously, sparking controversy in Silicon Valley. Suhail Doshi, ex-Mixpanel CEO, exposed Parekh's alleged moonlighting and questioned the authenticity of his resume on X. This incident has ignited discussions about ethics and transparency within the tech startup community.

title: 'Two best spinners ... ': Ganguly slams India's 'surprising' XI call
content: India's squad selection for the second Test against England has sparked controversy, with legends like Ganguly, Gavaskar, and Shastri questioning the changes. The inclusion of three new players and the resting of Bumrah, along with Kuldeep's omission, have drawn criticism. Concerns are raised about India's bowling strength and the decision to rest a key player in a crucial match.

title: Ronaldo pens heartfelt note on Jota's passing: 'It doesn't make sense' - Read
content: Cristiano Ronaldo is mourning the loss of his fellow Portuguese teammate, Diogo Jota, and his brother André, who tragically died in a car accident in Spain. Jota, a Liverpool player, had recently celebrated Portugal's Nations League victory with Ronaldo and had just gotten married.

title: 'No clear association found': AIIMS department refutes Siddaramaiah's charges
content: AIIMS Delhi doctors refuted Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah's claim linking COVID-19 vaccines to sudden cardiac deaths in Hassan, citing a study showing no clear association. They emphasized vaccines' crucial role in reducing mortality during the pandemic.

title: Leave India...: Foxconn to Chinese staff at Indian iPhone factories; What's Beijing's role in this
content: Apple's iPhone production faces disruption as Foxconn experiences a significant withdrawal of Chinese engineers from its Indian facilities, impacting the ramp-up for iPhone 17 manufacturing. This exodus, influenced by China's efforts to restrict technology transfer and skilled labor exports, threatens Apple's ambitious goals to shift iPhone production to India amidst rising geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts.

title: 'Will cross that bridge': India on US 500% tariff threat over Russian oil import
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar voiced concerns over the US threat to impose a 500% tariff on countries trading with Russia, including India. US Senator Lindsey Graham's proposed bill targets nations like India and China, accusing them of supporting Russia's war efforts through oil purchases. India has significantly increased its Russian oil imports since the Ukraine invasion, capitalizing on discounted prices.

title: No AI without immigration: Zuckerberg’s 11 new hires in superintelligence
content: Meta's new Superintelligence Lab showcases the significant role of immigrants in America's AI leadership. The lab's 11 top AI researchers, all immigrants from countries like India, China, and the UK, previously contributed to OpenAI, DeepMind, and Google.

title: New Bengal BJP president: Samik Bhattacharya replaces Sukanta Majumdar
content: Samik Bhattacharya is the new Bharatiya Janata Party chief in West Bengal. The Rajya Sabha MP's nomination was unanimous. He succeeds Sukanta Majumdar. Bhattacharya has a long history with the BJP and RSS. He previously won a Basirhat assembly bypoll. Party leaders praise his ability to unite different factions. His calm demeanor and experience are expected to benefit the party.

title: Bihar polls: AAP to go solo; 'INDIA bloc only for LS elections', says Kejriwal
content: Arvind Kejriwal announced Aam Aadmi Party will participate in the Bihar Assembly elections. The party will contest solo. There will be no alliance with the INDIA bloc or Congress. Kejriwal made the announcement during a visit to Gujarat. He alleged Congress contested Visavadar bypolls to undermine AAP. He also accused BJP of using Congress to divide votes.

title: Big win: Trump's 'beautiful bill' passes key US House vote; what's next
content: The US House advanced President Trump's tax and spending bill, overcoming initial Republican opposition. The bill, previously passed by the House and narrowly cleared by the Senate, aims to increase military spending, fund deportation programs, and extend tax cuts.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce end friendship with Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce reportedly ended their friendship with Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds. Sources say Swift grew tired of Lively's drama, especially the legal issues surrounding the 'It Ends With Us' movie. Lively's lawsuit against Justin Baldoni and the subsequent subpoena of Swift strained the friendship. Kelce also unfollowed Reynolds, showing support for Swift.

title: Ayesha Curry regrets Red Table Talk: Says edit distorted her words on marriage
content: Ayesha Curry expressed discomfort with public scrutiny. She regretted her 2019 Red Table Talk appearance with Jada Pinkett Smith. Ayesha felt misrepresented by the editing. She spoke about insecurities as Stephen Curry's wife. She addressed critics on Instagram. Ayesha expressed gratitude to Jada Pinkett Smith. She is now a proud wife and mother. She has moved past the public scrutiny.

title: Travis Kelce reveals how dating Taylor Swift changed his life
content: Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce is in the news. His relationship with singer Taylor Swift brought intense media attention. Kelce spoke about paparazzi and maintaining normalcy. He and Swift enjoy life despite the spotlight. Swift supports Kelce, attending games. Kelce focuses on football, aiming for another Super Bowl. They navigate their relationship on their own terms.

title: ‘Confirm he’s the father’: Puka Nacua’s girlfriend seeks custody, expenses
content: Los Angeles Rams' Puka Nacua faces legal issues. Hallie Aiono, his former partner, filed a petition. She seeks paternity confirmation and full custody of their unborn child. Aiono also wants financial support for pregnancy and legal fees. Nacua has not responded publicly. This situation could become a high-profile legal fight as he returns to Rams camp.

title: Red Panda injured in WNBA halftime fall: Pat McAfee relays health update
content: Red Panda, the renowned halftime entertainer, suffered a fractured wrist during a WNBA Commissioner's Cup Final performance after a unicycle malfunction. Following the fall, she received immediate medical attention in Minneapolis, with Lynx staff providing support. Pat McAfee shared an update from her team, expressing gratitude for the outpouring of support and well-wishes as she heads home for further treatment.

title: Taylor Swift surprise act rocks Tight End U: Kelce beams with pride
content: Pop sensation Taylor Swift surprised everyone at Tight End University event in Nashville. Travis Kelce planned this secretly. Swift joined Kane Brown on stage. She performed her hit song “Shake It Off”. Kelce revealed Swift prepared backstage. She impressed everyone with her impromptu performance. Fans admired Swift and Kelce's supportive relationship. The event became unforgettable due to Swift's electrifying presence.

title: 'No one can decide except ...': India on Dalai Lama successor; snubs China
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju asserted that only the Dalai Lama has the authority to decide his successor, directly addressing China's claims. This statement follows the Dalai Lama's declaration that the Gaden Phodrang Trust will manage the selection of his reincarnation.

title: ITR filing: Why is ITR-2 still not available on Income Tax portal? Top reasons
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: Taxpayers filing ITR-2 and ITR-3 face delays as the Income Tax Department hasn't released the utilities due to extensive changes in the forms. These forms, applicable for individuals with complex financial profiles, require comprehensive technical modifications. Recognizing the time needed for system readiness, the CBDT has extended the ITR filing deadline to September 15, 2025.

title: Honeymoon murder rerun? Newlywed gets husband killed to keep 15-yr affair with uncle alive
content: In Bihar's Aurangabad, a 45-day-old marriage ended tragically with the murder of Priyanshu Kumar Singh, allegedly orchestrated by his wife, Gunja Singh. Motivated by a desire to continue her long-term affair with her maternal uncle, Gunja conspired to eliminate her husband, drawing inspiration from the Meghalaya honeymoon murder case.

title: IND vs ENG: 'My dad always wore a flat cap', says teary-eyed Chris Woakes
content: Chris Woakes, the England seamer, paid tribute to his late father, Roger, at Edgbaston. Woakes got emotional while discussing his father, who passed away last May, and revealed a tattoo on his left tricep in his memory.

title: 'Tears of Joy!' Sargun Mehta reacts as Ravie Dubey joins Ranbir and Yash in ‘Ramayana’
content: Sargun Mehta expresses immense joy as Ravie Dubey is confirmed to play Lakshman in Namit Malhotra's Ramayana, starring Ranbir Kapoor and Sai Pallavi. She shared a heartfelt post and behind-the-scenes video, highlighting the significance of this epic project.

title: IND vs ENG: Elite company! Yashasvi Jaiswal enters club of Bradman, Richards
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal made history in the second Test against England. He became the first Indian to score fifty-plus runs in seven consecutive Tests against England at the start of his career. Jaiswal also joined an elite group of batters with 900+ runs in their first seven Tests against England. He scored 87 runs. Shubman Gill remained unbeaten with 114 runs.

title: India-US trade deal: India eyes middle ground; mulls special move for US food imports
content: India and the US are in intense negotiations to finalize a trade agreement, focusing on US market access for GM crops. A 'self-certification' system for US exporters is being considered to streamline GM-free import requirements.

title: Cricket: After surpassing Yuvraj, Raina, can Vaibhav break this 12-year-old record?
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old Indian U-19 opener, is making waves in the Youth ODIs against England U-19. He recently smashed 86 off just 31 balls, including nine sixes, and is currently the leading run-scorer for India in the series.

title: Cannibal on US deportation flight? Noem makes shocking claim
content: Kristi Noem spoke about an incident. Federal agents apprehended an unauthorised immigrant. The immigrant allegedly consumed his own arms. This happened during a deportation flight. Noem shared this during a visit with President Trump. The visit was to the "Alligator Alcatraz" deportation facility. Ron DeSantis expects initial detainees soon. The administration encourages voluntary departure.

title: Mother, teenage son stabbed to death at Lajpat Nagar home; probe on
content: A shocking double murder occurred in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar. Ruchika, 42, and her son Karsh, 14, were found dead in their home. Police discovered the bodies after family reported a locked door. Both victims suffered fatal injuries from sharp weapons. Ruchika's husband alerted the authorities. The police are investigating, gathering evidence, and reviewing CCTV footage.

title: Mukesh Ambani-led RIL to group all its FMCG brands under new company; IPO plans in works
content: Reliance Industries plans to consolidate its FMCG brands into a new entity named New Reliance Consumer Products Ltd (New RCPL), a direct RIL subsidiary. This restructuring aims to attract specialized investors and facilitate a potential stock market debut for the retail division.

title: ‘Stop, let him go’: PIO sparks mid-air brawl, ends up with black eye - video
content: Ishaan Sharma, an India-origin man, was arrested following a mid-air altercation with Keanu Evans on a Miami-Philadelphia flight. Evans claims Sharma initiated the conflict with bizarre threats, leading to a physical confrontation. Passengers' videos captured the brawl, showing Evans defending himself.

title: CBSE to begin Class 10, 12 practical exams for compartment- check details
content: CBSE will conduct Class 10 and 12 practical exams for compartment students from July 10 to 15, 2025. Eligible students include those marked for practical or both theory and practical reattempts. Exams will be held at respective schools or designated centres. Marks must be uploaded the same day and students must report by July 7 with necessary documents.

title: Disha Salian case: MVA demands apology from Fadnavis, BJP after SIT rules out foul play
content: Following a Mumbai Police SIT report ruling out foul play in the Disha Salian death case, MVA leaders, including Sanjay Raut and Rohit Pawar, are demanding a public apology from CM Fadnavis, Eknath Shinde, and other BJP leaders. They accuse the BJP of exploiting the case for political gain by linking Aaditya Thackeray to Salian's death.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Is Lord's Test more important than the series?': Sangakkara questions decision to rest Bumrah
content: India's decision to rest Jasprit Bumrah for the second Test against England has drawn criticism, especially from former players like Kumar Sangakkara, Ravi Shastri and Dale Steyn. With India trailing 0-1 in the series, the team management's decision to stick to a pre-decided plan of resting Bumrah has raised questions about their approach to crucial matches and team selection strategy.

title: Trump tariff wars: US seals trade deal with Vietnam; India next? Why China should worry
content: China is increasingly worried about US efforts to forge agreements with allies, potentially isolating Chinese firms from global supply chains. Washington is actively negotiating deals with Asian and European partners to limit China's involvement, citing unfair trade practices.

title: Shefali Jariwala’s father Satish Jariwala weeps inconsolably as Parag Tyagi consoles him
content: Days after Shefali Jariwala's shocking demise, a prayer meet was held in her memory on July 2. A viral video showed Shefali’s father, Satish Jariwala, weeping inconsolably, supported by a visibly emotional Parag Tyagi. The invite for the meet poignantly read: "Some stars shine too brightly to ever fade — even after they’re gone, their light remains."

title: 'Took selfie, left chilling msg': Man enters woman's home posing as delivery agent, rapes her
content: In Pune's Kondhwa area, a 22-year-old woman was allegedly raped in her home on Wednesday evening by an unidentified man posing as a courier delivery executive. The man gained entry while the woman was alone, claiming to have a delivery. Police are investigating the incident, reviewing CCTV footage, and have registered a case.

title: Slapgate: K'taka senior cop seeks VRS after CM's public slap gesture
content: Narayan V Baramani, Additional SP of Dharwad, has sought voluntary retirement after a public incident in Belagavi where Chief Minister Siddaramaiah gestured to slap him. Baramani, with 31 years of service, cited humiliation in his VRS request, submitted a month ago. Despite attempts by the CM and Home Minister to dissuade him, Baramani awaits the government's decision on his plea.

title: Who is Soham Parekh? The mysterious 'Indian techie' who has US start-ups riled
content: Soham Parekh, an Indian techie, faces accusations of deceiving US startups by simultaneously holding positions at multiple companies. This sparked controversy after founders exposed inconsistencies in his resume, location, and availability. The incident ignited debates about remote hiring practices, ethical conduct, and transparency within the tech industry, leading to widespread discussions and memes.

title: Wimbledon 2025: Why do players wear all-white? Here's all you need to know
content: Wimbledon, renowned for its strict all-white dress code since the Victorian era, has faced controversies and undergone occasional updates. The All England Club eased restrictions in 2023, allowing dark-colored undershorts to address concerns about menstruation.

title: 'What are they waiting for?': Trump erupts as US House dithers on 'beautiful bill'
content: Donald Trump has expressed his frustration with Republicans in Congress over delays in passing his tax and spending bill, dubbed the "One Big Beautiful Bill." The bill faces opposition from both fiscal conservatives concerned about the rising national debt and moderates worried about potential re-election consequences due to healthcare cuts.

title: Chess | Carlsen takes a fresh jibe at Gukesh - 'In terms of impressing me...'
content: Magnus Carlsen, after the first day of the SuperUnited Croatia Rapid & Blitz 2025, acknowledged Gukesh's improvement but stated he's yet to be truly impressed by the young Indian chess players. He praised Praggnanandhaa's recent classical tournament wins, highlighting his consistent performance.

title: Sharp contrast! How top e-commerce stocks Swiggy & Eternal are outshining Chinese counterparts
content: Indian e-commerce giants Swiggy and Eternal are outperforming domestic indices and Asian peers, fueled by the rapid growth of quick commerce. This sector, projected to reach $100 billion by 2030, sees established players like Swiggy, Zomato's Blinkit, and Zepto maintaining market dominance due to efficient delivery and established supply chains, contrasting with challenges faced by Chinese counterparts.

title: India’s first transgender clinic in Hyderabad reopened; Tata Trusts revives facility shut after USAID froze funds
content: Mitra Clinic, now Sabrang, was not only a dedicated healthcare facility for transgender people, but also as the first in India to be entirely staffed and managed by trans community members

title: Disha Salian took her own life, no foul play found in probe: police tell Bombay HC
content: Disha Salian ended her own life, and the postmortem report mentions no signs of sexual and/or physical assault on the deceased, the police said in an affidavit

title: T.N. SHRC seeks report on assault of three women at police station in Tiruvallur
content: Taking suo motu cognisance of an article on the incident published in The Hindu, the Commission sought a report from the Tiruvallur Superintendent of Police within six weeks

title: Late Karnataka DGP’s daughter creates ruckus at shop, police register NCR
content: Late retired DGP Om Prakash’s daughter Kritika vandalised a shop near her house and assaulted the shopkeeper

title: Uttarakhand Government halts Char Dham Yatra owing to bad weather
content: “Our priority during the yatra is the safety of all pilgrims... All our district officials, disaster management teams, National Disaster Response Force and State Disaster Response Force are fully prepared,” Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said

title: Kabaddi player dies after dog bite
content: Brijesh, a resident of Farana village, was bitten by a puppy two months ago while rescuing it from a drain.

title: BJP leader Laxman demands probe against alleged irregularities in Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams
content: BJP leader Laxman expressed concerns against alleged irregularities that he said had shattered the faith of devotees who contribute to the temple’s hundi

title: Sambhal temple-mosque row: Court to hear plea for ban on namaz at disputed site on July 21
content: Chandausi court sets date to hear plea seeking ban on namaz at disputed Shahi Jama Masjid turned temple

title: Himachal Pradesh monsoon rain: Death toll in Mandi cloudburst mounts to 13, search underway for 29 missing
content: Ten cloudbursts, three flash floods and a landslip were witnessed in different parts of Mandi district on Tuesday (July 1, 2025)

title: Only Dalai Lama and conventions established by him can decide successor: Rijiju
content: “All those who follow the Dalai Lama feel that the Incarnation is to be decided by the established convention and as per the wish of the Dalai Lama himself. Nobody else has the right to decide it except him and the conventions in place,” Mr. Rijiju said

title: M.V. Jayarajan blames then DySP, Deputy Collector for Koothuparamba firing, says new Kerala DGP had no role
content: Jayarajan says Ravada Chandrashekhar, the then ASP, had no role in the 1994 incident and was not part of any conspiracy

title: Transformer procurement ‘scam’: Will soon decide on permitting DVAC to register FIR, T.N. govt. tells Madras HC
content: Appearing before Justice P. Velmurugan, Advocate General P.S. Raman says, nothing would survive in Arappor Iyakkam’s plea to register FIR

title: Telangana likely to receive above normal rainfall in July; it can boost agricultural activity: IMD
content: IMD said that the above-normal rainfall increases the risk of localised flooding and infrastructure disruptions, especially in low-lying and urban areas such as Hyderabad

title: Puri stampede: Odisha Government seeks information from public
content: The State Government through a public notice urged the people to share information, video footage or any other materials related to the stampede

title: Newly-elected AAP MLA Sanjeev Arora inducted into Punjab Cabinet
content: Governor Gulab Chand Kataria administered the oath of office and secrecy to Mr. Arora in a ceremony at the Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh

title: Insurance firm not liable to pay compensation for death of persons driving rashly: Supreme Court
content: The court refused to grant ₹80 lakh compensation sought by the wife, son and parents of a man who died while driving a car at high speed.

title: Public events, processions require police permission; must conclude by 11.30 p.m.: Mangaluru City Police
content: Mangaluru City Police have come out with detailed guidelines ahead of the festival season to ensure maintenance of law and order and public peace

title: Kolkata gang rape case: Calcutta High Court directs Bengal government to file affidavit on progress of probe
content: Bengal government has been directed to produce the case diary of the investigation before the next hearing on July 10

title: ED questions ex-Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain in DJB-linked PMLA case
content: The investigation pertains to allegations of corruption in the augmentation of some sewage treatment plants by DJB

title: Government indifferent as farmers sink deeper into debt: Rahul on Maharashtra farmer deaths
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the government of ignoring farmers’ demands for a loan waiver and a legal guarantee for minimum support price (MSP) for crops

title: PM Narendra Modi five-nation tour LIVE: PM Modi to address Ghana’s Parliament
content: “Ghana is known as the land of gold, not just for what lies under your soil but as much for the warmth and strength in your heart,” PM Modi says, addressing Ghana’s Parliament

title: Tamil Nadu Rainbow Coalition criticises Thol. Thirumavalavan’s remarks on same-sex love
content: In a video clip that has gone viral, a youngster, during an event, seeks Mr. Thirumavalavan’s views on same-sex love, to which he responds that it is a form of “perversion”.

title: Search operation underway in J&K's Kishtwar
content: The cordon and search operation follows an encounter that broke out between terrorists and security forces in the heavily forested Kanzal Mandu area of the Kuchal-Chatroo belt

title: Skeletal remains found during recombing at Telangana pharma factory blast site
content: Telangana government-appointed expert committee is scheduled to make their first visit to the site today

title: Delhi HC restrains Patanjali from airing ‘disparaging’ ads against Dabur Chyawanprash
content: Delhi High Court restrains Patanjali from disparaging Dabur Chyawanprash in advertisements, with further hearing scheduled for July 14

title: Private school management associations in Andhra Pradesh defer protest after assurance by government officials
content: In a statement, the members said that extended discussions with the government officials concluded on a positive note and “our concerns have been taken to the notice of HRD Minister, along with a clear assurance for resolution”

title: Portion of Kottayam Medical College Hospital building in Kerala collapses, 1 killed
content: Two others injured. Collapsed section was part of old, disused bathroom attached to a ward, say hospital authorities

title: Telangana CM to launch statewide distribution of new ration cards on July 14: Uttam Kumar Reddy
content: The Minster said that efforts were underway to resume the long-stalled Srisailam Left Bank Canal (SLBC) works

title: Andhra Minister Kondapalli Srinivas seeks bankers cooperation for entrepreneurs
content: Kondapalli Srinivas said State Bank of India had been playing a vital role in the economic development of Andhra Pradesh

title: In pictures: Amarnath Yatra begins in Kashmir
content: The annual Amarnath Yatra began on July 3, 2025, with the first batches of pilgrims setting off from the twin base camps in Baltal and Nunwan towards the 3880-metre-high cave shrine in the south Kashmir Himalayas

title: Three militants arrested; arms, ammunition seized in Manipur
content: Security forces seized a .303 rifle with magazine, two 9mm pistols with magazines, one 12-bore single-barrel gun, four hand-grenades, a wireless set with charger and two detonators

title: Air India cancels Delhi-Washington flight; says extended maintenance work due to technical snag found during stopover in Vienna
content: The airline emphasised that the decision was made in line with its “voluntary enhanced pre-flight safety checks” initiative, part of its broader efforts to ensure operational safety and minimise last-minute inconveniences

title: Sivaganga custodial death: Key witness alleges threat to life, seeks armed police protection
content: Mr. Saktheeswaran, in his plea to the DGP, said he feared for his life as well as the safety of his family members

title: Fire at tyre manufacturing unit in Hyderabad’s Katedan industrial area
content: Three fire engines were deployed to contain the blaze at a tyre manufacturing unit in Katedan, which was brought under control after several hours.

title: Devotee booked for making ‘false claim’ of cockroach in laddu prasadam at Srisailam
content: An inquiry by the temple officials revealed that the devotee had intentionally placed a locust in the laddu and made false claims that he found a cockroach in it

title: Landslide near Sonprayag; Kedarnath yatra temporarily suspended in Uttarakhand
content: The road has been completely blocked by the landslide debris and stones at Munkatiya sliding zone, prompting the administration to stop the yatra temporarily

title: Fire breaks out near Sri Govindaraja Swamy temple in Tirupati
content: The cause of the fire was attributed to short circuit in one of the shops on the street leading to  Sri Govindaraja Swamy temple

title: TTD warns contract employees of ‘dire consequences’ if they try to affect devotee services
content: The management is ready to address the genuine issues raised by the workers, but any step that impedes the working of the temple will be seriously dealt with, it warns

title: Man enters Pune woman's home posing as courier delivery agent, rapes her
content: The accused also clicked a selfie on the victim's phone and left a message on it, warning her not to inform about the crime to anyone as he had taken her pictures and would share them on social media

title: Sivaganga youth’s custodial death: AIADMK, BJP cadres condemn DMK govt.
content: The leaders of the AIADMK and the BJP visited victim Ajith Kumar’s house and consoled the family members

title: West Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh visits CPI(M) leader Anil Das who was ‘assaulted’ by TMC woman
content: An FIR has been filed against Trinamool Congress leader Baby Kole against the assault, but she has not been arrested yet drawing backlash from the BJP leadership.

title: Message conveyed with great clarity: Jaishankar on objective of Operation Sindoor
content: A joint statement issued by Quad Foreign Ministers unequivocally condemned all acts of terrorism and violent extremism in all their forms and manifestations, including cross-border terrorism

title: Kolkata college gang rape: Police trying to get details of accused Monojit's meetings before arrest
content: The investigators were also checking if the other two accused — Zaib Ahmed and Pramit Mukherjee — also contacted any person before they were picked up by the police

title: Apache helicopters set for delivery within two weeks after India-U.S. defence talks
content: The first batch of three Apache AH-64E attack helicopters will be delivered by July 15 and the next batch of three helicopters will be delivered by November 2025, sources said

title: Are gig workers a part of India’s labour data?
content: Though gig work is technically included under economic activity in the Periodic Labour Force Survey, without a specific classification, the survey fails to offer visibility into the unique nature of digital labour, characterised by multiple job roles, dependence on algorithms, lack of formal contract and absence of safety metrics

title: Case against Pawan Kalyan in Tamil Nadu an attack on Sanātana Dharma, says BJP State president Madhav
content: Calling the DMK government a tyranny, A.P. State BJP chief alleged that it had repeatedly targeted sacred institutions, sought to dismantle traditional values, and harboured contempt for the Vedas and Vedic culture.

title: Singaiah’s death: A.P. CM Naidu sees bid to distort facts
content: The YSRCP leaders have forced the victim’s wife to say that his condition turned critical in the ambulance, alleges the Chief Minister

title: India, U.S. to ink 10-year defence framework: Pentagon
content: In the phone conversation on Tuesday, Mr. Singh urged Mr. Hegseth to expedite the delivery of GE F404 engines to power the Tejas Light Combat Aircraft, people familiar with the matter said

title: BJP accuses Tejashwi Yadav of appeasement politics over Waqf Act
content: BJP MP Jagdambika Pal on Wednesday accused RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav of misleading Muslims with his remarks on the amended Waqf Act ahead of the Bihar Assembly elections. Pal said the Act aims to ensure transparency and benefit poor and backward sections of the community

title: Second batch of pilgrims leave for Amarnath yatra from Jammu
content: The yatra started early morning from the twin tracks— the traditional 48-km Nunwan-Pahalgam route and the 14-km Baltal route

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder: 3 accused remanded to judicial custody
content: The three were arrested from Madhya Pradesh on the charge of concealing evidence in the murder. On June 26, they had been remanded to police custody for six days

title: Three Indians abducted in Mali amid Al-Qaeda-claimed terrorist attack; India asks West African nation to secure their safe release
content: "The incident occurred on July 1, when a group of armed assailants carried out a coordinated attack at the factory premises and forcibly took three Indian nationals as hostages," the MEA said

title: Triplicane High Road grapples with traffic snarls, crumbling infrastructure
content: Triplicane High Road sees heavy daily activity, but its narrow design and poor infrastructure can’t support the load

title: SHO suspended for beating auto-driver in Bihar’s Sheikhpura
content: Victim allege that the police officer used casteist remarks against him and forced him to lick his own spit; police denied the charges

title: U.P. school merger plan anti-poor, should be dropped: Mayawati
content: The U.P. government is planning to merge schools having enrolment of less than 50 students with nearby educational facilities to make the education system “more functional and viable”.

title: Tiger deaths in the sanctuary
content: The death of five tigers by poisoning in MM Hills Wildlife sanctuary has shocked environmentalists and raised larger questions about conservation

title: Odisha civil servants announce to go on mass leave demanding arrest of BJP leader
content: The protest comes in the wake of the brutal attack on Ratnakar Sahoo, Additional Commissioner of the Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation, who was dragged from his office and beaten by BJP workers.

title: Major chunk of biodegradable waste processed in compost plants in Ernakulam
content: Of the 780 tonnes of biodegradable waste generated a day, around 570 tonnes are being processed at compost plants

title: NDA will form govt. in Bihar with two-thirds majority, says Rajnath
content:
Addressing meeting of the Bihar unit of BJP in Patna, Defence Minister targets RJD for ‘decades
of injustice’ and asserts that only the ruling alliance can bring back the ‘lost glory’ of the State

title: Steps sought to address frequent snarl-ups on Kozhikode-Kannur NH
content: Ambulance operators allege non-compliance with traffic control norms by road construction workers; they also say lane discipline violations by private bus operators worsening the situation

title: Fake cardiologist row: NHRC directs Centre for nationwide verification of cath labs
content: In its report, the NHRC has also flagged ‘serious irregularities’ in the implementation of Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Aarogya Yojana

title: Tourism entrepreneurs in Kozhikode on a sticky wicket
content: Bad weather conditions, safety concerns and lack of facilities at ecotourism spots badly affect entrepreneurs who run farmstays and homestays; shoddy condition of roads adds to their woes

title: Haryana Congress district presidents likely to be announced around mid-July, says senior leader B. K. Hariprasad
content: The process was kicked off in the first week of June by Lok Sabha Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi. The AICC and Pradesh Congress Committee observers had begun the consultations in June second week to shortlist the panel of candidates.

title: India now sole govt. with vote in emoji, text standards body Unicode Consortium
content: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology rejoins the Unicode Consortium as a Supporting Member, procuring a seat at the table for India in the text and emoji standardisation body

title: Silence after the Sigachi blast: families wait for missing victims, officials stay mum
content: A 20-year-old had reported for his first day at work on that fateful day while another, just 10 months into the job, was planning to visit his family in Uttar Pradesh in November

title: Air pollution is a greater threat than tobacco, says doctor
content: He said the rise of non-communicable diseases such as cancer, diabetes, and cardiovascular disorders has overtaken communicable diseases as dominant health burden in India, particularly in southern States

title: Operating the Sigachi plant for 35 years without a single incident, says MD
content: Company said an internal safety review has been initiated and Sigachi remains committed to cooperating with all legal, safety, and regulatory audits to strengthen safety norms

title: Six minor girls ‘trapped in horrific conditions’ rescued from orchestra groups in Bihar
content: The rescued girls were trafficked from New Delhi, West Bengal, and Nepal. The operation was carried out based on intelligence provided by Narayani Seva Sansthan, and inputs from the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC)

title: Commuters say recent speed restrictions on west section cause delay in train services
content: The Southern Railway has directed the loco-pilots of the suburban trains operated from Moore Market complex to Arakkonam, via Avadi and Tiruvallur, to maintain a speed of 15 km per hour at 12 places

title: Pune-based hospital performs bilateral lung transplant on Army soldier
content: With approvals from the Zonal Transplant Coordination Centre, a green corridor was established to bring the organs from Dombivli to Pune in under two hours

title: Jammu and Kashmir Police warn action against people circulating content related to ‘removal of flag’ in Srinagar
content: The police directive comes hours after protests broke out over the alleged removal of a banner set up for a Muharram procession in Srinagar’s Saida Kadal area by the J&K Police

title: India not just a partner but co-traveller in Ghana’s development journey: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi said both sides have set a target of doubling the two-way trade in the next five years and that India is not just a partner but a co-traveller in Ghana’s development journey

title: Liverpool's Jota, brother die in single-car crash
content: Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has died alongside his brother, André Silva, in a car crash near Zamora, Spain in the early hours of Thursday morning, the Civil Guard told the Associated Press.

title: Kershaw becomes MLB's 4th lefty with 3,000 K's
content: Clayton Kershaw joined Randy Johnson, Steve Carlton and CC Sabathia as the only left-handers in MLB history to reach 3,000 strikeouts, pulling the feat during the Dodgers' 5-4 win over the White Sox.

title: Muncy (knee) helped off, but Dodgers 'optimistic'
content: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said the "hope" is Max Muncy sustained only a sprain in a collision with the White Sox's Michael A. Taylor.

title: Raleigh, rookie Wilson among All-Star starters
content: Mariners catcher Cal Raleigh, MLB's home run leader, and AL League Rookie of the Year candidate Jacob Wilson of the Athletics are among the All-Star Game starters.

title: Mets' Lindor ends long slump after lineup change
content: Francisco Lindor was dropped from the leadoff spot for the first time in 191 consecutive starts Wednesday night and helped the Mets end a four-game losing skid.

title: Sources: Ayton to sign 2-year deal with Lakers
content: Former No. 1 pick Deandre Ayton, who finalized a buyout with the Blazers on Sunday, will sign a two-year deal with the Lakers, sources told ESPN.

title: Bronny: Not focused on speculation about LeBron
content: While speculation swirls about LeBron James' future, Bronny James is working out with the Lakers' summer league team and was told by his dad "to not worry about it."

title: Red Panda has broken wrist, is out of hospital
content: Red Panda's recovery should take a few months, her agency said the day after she fell off her unicycle and crashed to the court during halftime of the WNBA Commissioner's Cup final.

title: 💰 8 NFL players who excel at 'securing the bag'
content: Which NFL players have negotiated the most profitable contracts over their careers? Bill Barnwell gives his picks.

title: Poch: 'Desperate' Luna sets example for USMNT
content: ST. LOUIS -- United States coach Mauricio Pochettino praised goal scorer Diego Luna for being "desperate to play" for the national team after the winger scored twice in a 2-1 Gold Cup semifinal win over Guatemala on Wednesday.

title: Jiménez propels Mexico to Gold Cup final vs. U.S.
content: Raúl Jiménez scored the winning goal for Mexico against Honduras in Wednesday's Gold Cup semifinal, securing their spot in a title defense matchup against the United States.

title: WC hosts can serve Gold Cup bans in friendlies
content: Concacaf confirmed on Wednesday that any red card suspensions incurred by players from the United States, Canada or Mexico during the Gold Cup will be served in their next international friendly match, rather than carrying over to next year's World Cup.

title: Stoney slams 'inexcusable' Canada loss to USWNT

title: Giroud on LAFC: MLS style of play 'didn't suit me'

title: João Pedro signs for Chelsea in $82M deal
content: the 23-year-old has signed an eight-year deal at a total of £60 million ($82m) with the club . sources have told ESPN that he prefers a move to the club amid interest from Newcastle . Pedro made the move to English football in 2020, spending three years at Watford .

title: Euro 2025 team-by-team preview, predictions, key players, more

title: From Bill Walsh to Bill Belichick: What happens when a legendary NFL coach moves on to college football?
